metadata.title: CVE-2018-20843 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7, XML input including XML names thatcontain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a highamount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable fordenial-of-service attacks).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.4
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.4
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

libvtk-java - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libvtk5.10 - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libvtk5.10-qt4 - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-vtk - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
tcl-vtk - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
vtk-examples - 5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libxmltok1 - 1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.4').
xmlrpc-c package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vnc4 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ayttm package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cableswig package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.10.1+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
libxmltok package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2').
